description.narrative:
Fundacion CEJIL Mesoamerica has applied to Sida for funding of 6 000 000 SEK to support CEJIL's core work under a project called "Towards Increased Protection of Human Rights in El Salvador and Honduras", to be implemented during the period of 2017-2019. CEJIL´s mission is to contribute to the full enjoyment of human rights in the Americas through effective use of the tools of the Inter-American System and other International Human Rights Law protection mechanisms. It's mandate is carried out within three programme areas: 1) Legal Defence Programme; 2) Training and Dissemination Programme; and 3) Strengthening of the Inter-American System Programme. Within these areas CEJIL provides free legal advice and training in the use of international human rights instruments to victims of human rights violations, their families, civil society organizations and government agencies, while working towards full implementation of international human rights norms in Organization of American States OEA member states.
Closely planned and coordinated with local non-governmental human rights organizations, the intervention is aimed at strengthening the protection of human rights in El Salvador and Honduras by building local capacity to access and use the Inter-American Human Rights System tools. The intended intervention will support CEJIL's core activities, with special emphasis on: transitional justice and state violence in El Salvador; investigation and documentation of responsibility of non-state actors in serious human rights violations in Honduras; strengthening of strategic litigation capacity of women's and LGBTI organizations; creating access to sexual and reproductive health and therapeutic abortion in El Salvador; and supporting judicial independence and protection of human rights defenders in Honduras.
As the expected outcome of the intervention, protection of human rights and capacity of local organizations in El Salvador and Honduras to use the tools of the Inter-American Human Rights System to increase access to justice will be strengthened; national and regional strategies that contribute to the identification, prevention and sanctioning of human rights violations committed by state and non-state actors will be in place; actions directed to creation and implementation of norms and practises guaranteeing rights of women and members of LGBTI community will be implemented; and judicial independence and the protection of human rights defenders will be strengthened in Honduras through coordination of actions that contribute to strengthening of rule of law.
The intervention is closely linked with other interventions and Swedish partners in Honduras and El Salvador, namely the Inter-American Institute for Human Rights and the Fund for Global Human Rights, giving this intervention additional value for the Swedish cooperation.

Insatsen innebär finansiering om 6 000 000 kronor för den regionala organisationen Fundación CEJIL Mesoamerica 2017-2019. CEJIL är en regional organisation som ger stöd till lokala MR-försvarare; stödjer stater i att utveckla strategier för att förebygga och beivra MR-övergrepp; uppmärksammar MR-övergrepp internationellt och representerar offer för MR-övergrepp i det Inter-Amerikanska Systemet för Mänskliga Rättigheter. CEJIL arbetar också direkt med det Inter-Amerikanska MR-systemets institutioner (framförallt Domstolen och Kommissionen), i syfte att göra dessa mer inkluderande och effektiva. Sidas bidrag ges i form av ett icke-öronmärkt kärnstöd till CEJILs reguljära verksamhet, men CEJIL visar i sitt programförslag till Ambassaden tydligt vilken del av sin verksamhet som organisationen ska utöka med hjälp av det svenska bidraget, nämligen: (i) utökning av verksamheten i två specifika länder, Honduras och El Salvador. (ii) vidareutveckling av arbetet inom specifika tematiska prioriteringar i de två ovannämnda länderna, inklusive situationen med ökat våld i El Salvador och kopplingar mellan näringsliv och mänskliga rättigheter inom ramen för icke-statliga aktörers ansvar i Honduras. (iii) utökning av CEJIL: s arbete relaterat till skyddet av människorättsförsvarare som arbetar med miljö, försvar av kvinnors rättigheter och tillgång till rättslig prövning för försvar av sexuella och reproduktiva rättigheter och förbättrat skydd av LGBTI-rättigheter.
Sida kommer att fokusera sin uppföljning särskilt på CEJILs resultat inom dessa områden. Stödet till CEJIL kompletterar väl det stöd som ges genom Global Fund for Human Rights direkt till lokala organisationer och MR-försvarare i Honduras och El Salvador.

description.narrative: CEJIL is a highly relevant actor in human rights in Central America and forms an integral part in the Inter-American Human Rights System, coordinating closely with Inter-American Human Rights Commission (IACHR) and Inter-American Court of Human Rights, serving as a bridge between victims and the regional HR bodies. CEJIL's high level of credibility and professionalism mark the difference in achieving concrete results. Important results in access to justice were achieved during 2019, especially in relation to access to sexual and reproductive health rights in El Salvador and women criminalized for spontaneous abortions. Advocacy work, coordination among various organizations working in favor of decriminalization, training for public health officials in international HR standards, public events on cases currently under review by the IA Court, presentation of cases to the UN Working Group on Arbitrary Detentions, coordination of meetings between IACHR and 15 Salvadoran women ex-detainees for spontaneous abortions, and litigation of Beatriz vrs. El Salvador-case under review by IACHR, are all actions to advance access to justice for Salvadoran women, which have helped keeping the issue under discussion and review, while reaching concrete advances in the IA system, such as various recommendations presented by IACHR to state of El Salvador in relation to women criminalized for spontaneous abortion. As to economic, social and cultural rights, advances were obtained in compliance with IA Court sentence in favor of HIV+ patients in Guatemala, through reparations by state of Guatemala to patients who were denied access to adequate treatment in the public health system. In relation to access to justice and reparations for serious human rights violations by state agents during armed conflicts, CEJIL played an important role in detaining Amnesty Law Congressional discussions in Guatemala and El Salvador, which were putting at risk sentences achieved in both countries. In relation to strengthening of democracy and rule of law with emphasis on judicial independence, concrete results were achieved in Guatemala where judicial independence has been widely debated in the political arena. Supported by CEJIL, IACHR ordered precautionary measures to Guatemalan judges thus creating applicable standards in the matter. During 2019, CEJIL carried out numerous actions in support of right to defend human rights in Nicaragua. Several advocacy and communication campaigns on behalf of Nicaraguan HR defenders and political prisoners were carried out (#LaSolidaridadNoEsDelito, #NavidadSinPresosPoliticos, #SOSNicaragua, #VocesConNicaragua). CEJIL also followed-up cases and precautionary measures ordered by IACHR, and presented arguments in IACHR session (November 2019) on compliance of Nicaraguan judiciary system with criminalization of political dissidents. Additionally, CEJIL played a role in the UN HR Council resolution on Promotion and Protection of Human Rights in Nicaragua (March 2019), urging Nicaraguan government to guarantee freedom of expression, assembly and demonstration. Overall, during this period CEJIL successfully strengthened its communication and advocacy work, managing to create public debate on key HR issues in the region, including a strong emphasis on justice for victims of violence against women in all its forms.
